doc.after: In the 1880s, white colonists arrived with Cecil Rhodes's British South Africa Company (BSAC).[24] In 1888, Rhodes obtained a concession for mining rights from King Lobengula of the Ndebele peoples.[25] He presented this concession to persuade the government of the United Kingdom to grant a royal charter to the company over Matabeleland, and its subject states such as Mashonaland as well.[26]
